items.title: Trump says Venezuelan airspace is closed
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump declared Venezuelan airspace closed on Saturday, a move that underscores the heightened tensions between the two countries as Trump has lobbed increasingly bellicose rhetoric at the Venezuelan government. Trump has no actual authority to restrict Venezuelan airspace, but he…

items.title: Consider airspace around Venezuela closed, Trump says
items.standfirst: The US cannot legally close another country's airspace, but Trump's comments could deter airlines from operating in Venezuela.
items.content: The US cannot legally close another country's airspace, but Trump's comments could deter airlines from operating in Venezuela.

items.content: Announcement comes after military build-up by US forces in region

items.title: Donald Trump says airspace above and around Venezuela is closed
items.standfirst: President made declaration in a social media post, after FAA last week warned airlines of ‘worsening security situation’Donald Trump said on Saturday that the airspace above and surrounding Venezuela is to be closed in its entirety.Trump, in a Truth Social post said: “To all Airlines, Pilots, Drug Dealers, and Human Traffickers, please consider THE AIRSPACE ABOVE AND SURROUNDING VENEZUELA TO BE CLOSED IN ITS ENTIRETY.” Continue reading...

items.content: President Donald Trump said Saturday morning that Venezuela’s airspace should be considered “closed” as he weighs military action against the South American nation.

items.content: No immediate response from Venezuela after President Trump’s makes the announcement on social media on Saturday.

items.content: US leader's post comes amid weeks of escalating rhetoric by US officials against Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

ai_summary: Donald Trump declared Venezuelan airspace closed on Saturday via social media post.
Trump's declaration could deter airlines from operating in Venezuela.
The US cannot legally close another country's airspace.
The announcement follows a military build-up by US forces in the region.
Trump's statement was directed at airlines, pilots, and potential criminals.

items.title: Russia pounds Ukraine with deadly strikes as peace negotiations enter crucial stage
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Kyiv in a deadly drone attack early Saturday, officials said. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced that he's sent an envoy to the U.S. to continue peace negotiations.
items.content: Russia attacked Kyiv in a deadly drone attack early Saturday, officials said. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced that he's sent an envoy to the U.S. to continue peace negotiations.

items.title: Russian attacks kill 3 in Kyiv as Ukrainian delegation travels to U.S.
items.standfirst: Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukrainian capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said.
items.content: Russian drone and missile attacks in and around the Ukrainian capital killed at least three people early Saturday, officials said.

items.title: Zelenskyy faces ‘mini-revolution’ as Yermak’s fall reshapes Ukraine’s wartime power system
items.standfirst: Exit of Zelenskyy’s most powerful aide could also have impact on Kyiv’s negotiating position in talks over ending warUkraine’s political system is bracing for a “mini-revolution” as the county’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, is forced to adapt to life without his closest adviser, chief enforcer and most loyal associate, Andriy Yermak, who resigned on Friday after his apartment was searched as part of a widening anti-corruption probe.Yermak’s resignation could have tremendous consequences for domestic governance, as well as for Ukraine’s negotiating position in talks over ending the war with Russia, where he had served as the head of Ukraine’s delegation to peace talks with the White House. Continue reading...
items.content: Exit of Zelenskyy’s most powerful aide could also have impact on Kyiv’s negotiating position in talks over ending warUkraine’s political system is bracing for a “mini-revolution” as the county’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, is forced to adapt to life without his closest adviser, chief enforcer and most loyal associate, Andriy Yermak, who resigned on Friday after his apartment was searched as part of a widening anti-corruption probe.Yermak’s resignation could have tremendous consequences for domestic governance, as well as for Ukraine’s negotiating position in talks over ending the war with Russia, where he had served as the head of Ukraine’s delegation to peace talks with the White House. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: A widening corruption scandal forced Ukraine's second most powerful person, Andriy Yermak, to resign.
items.content: A widening corruption scandal forced Ukraine's second most powerful person, Andriy Yermak, to resign.

items.title: What we know about resignation of top Ukraine official
items.standfirst: President Zelenskyy’s chief of staff has resigned after investigators searched his home amid a corruption scandal.
items.content: President Zelenskyy’s chief of staff has resigned after investigators searched his home amid a corruption scandal.

items.title: Zelenskyy’s top aide quits after anti-corruption searches of his home
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president announces departure of Andriy Yermak, who was leading peace talks with USVolodymyr Zelenskyy’s powerful chief of staff and closest ally, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies conducted searches at his apartment earlier today.The abrupt departure of the aide, who had been leading the latest round of the delicate peace negotiations with the US, was announced by the Ukrainian president in a late-afternoon social media video on Friday. Continue reading...
items.content: Ukrainian president announces departure of Andriy Yermak, who was leading peace talks with USVolodymyr Zelenskyy’s powerful chief of staff and closest ally, Andriy Yermak, has resigned after Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies conducted searches at his apartment earlier today.The abrupt departure of the aide, who had been leading the latest round of the delicate peace negotiations with the US, was announced by the Ukrainian president in a late-afternoon social media video on Friday. Continue reading...

items.title: Zelenskyy chief of staff resigns after property raid by Ukraine’s anti-corruption agencies – Europe live
items.standfirst: ‘I want there to be no rumours and speculation,’ Zelenskyy says as Andriy Yermak resignsThe Commission also totally rejected dismissed Russia’s criticism of Volodymyr Zelenskyy as “illegitimate” leader of Ukraine, after Vladimir Putin suggested yesterday that was a technical reason he couldn’t agree a peace deal with Zelenskyy.“President Zelensky is the democratically elected president, by the Ukrainian people, of Ukraine,” a commission spokesperson said in response, somewhat mockingly adding that Putin seems to have “some difficulties in recognising the democratically elected president of his neighbour country, Ukraine.”“Let me stress the fight against corruption is a key element for a country to join the EU, it requires continuous efforts and a strong capacity to fight corruption. This is a key element that we also address in our enlargement report that was published a couple of weeks ago, so we will continue to follow the situation very closely.” Continue reading...
items.content: ‘I want there to be no rumours and speculation,’ Zelenskyy says as Andriy Yermak resignsThe Commission also totally rejected dismissed Russia’s criticism of Volodymyr Zelenskyy as “illegitimate” leader of Ukraine, after Vladimir Putin suggested yesterday that was a technical reason he couldn’t agree a peace deal with Zelenskyy.“President Zelensky is the democratically elected president, by the Ukrainian people, of Ukraine,” a commission spokesperson said in response, somewhat mockingly adding that Putin seems to have “some difficulties in recognising the democratically elected president of his neighbour country, Ukraine.”“Let me stress the fight against corruption is a key element for a country to join the EU, it requires continuous efforts and a strong capacity to fight corruption. This is a key element that we also address in our enlargement report that was published a couple of weeks ago, so we will continue to follow the situation very closely.” Continue reading...

items.title: Top Zelenskyy aide at heart of U.S. peace talks resigns after being implicated in corruption probe
items.standfirst: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks resigned on Friday after being thrust into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia’s war
items.content: A top Ukrainian official at the heart of peace talks resigned on Friday after being thrust into the center of a massive corruption scandal, threatening to further weaken President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a crucial moment in negotiations to end Russia’s war

ai_summary: Andriy Yermak, Zelenskyy's top aide, resigned amid a corruption probe.
Yermak's resignation could impact Ukraine's peace talks with Russia.
Russian attacks killed three people in Kyiv on Saturday.
Zelenskyy sent an envoy to the US to continue peace negotiations.
Ukraine's political system is bracing for a "mini-revolution".

clusters.title: 11/29: Saturday Morning
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Announces Cancellation of Biden Executive Orders

items.title: 11/29: Saturday Morning
items.standfirst: President Trump announced that he’s canceling all executive orders that former President Joe Biden signed with an autopen, as authorities are looking for motive after National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom died from being fatally shot in Washington, D.C. Plus, take a trip back through history at the Delta Flight Museum and meet Japan's rising sushi star.
items.content: President Trump announced that he’s canceling all executive orders that former President Joe Biden signed with an autopen, as authorities are looking for motive after National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom died from being fatally shot in Washington, D.C. Plus, take a trip back through history at the Delta Flight Museum and meet Japan's rising sushi star.

items.title: Trump administration halts all asylum decisions after shooting of National Guard members
items.standfirst: The Trump administration has halted all asylum decisions and paused issuing visas for people traveling on Afghan passports days after a shooting near the White House that left one National Guard member dead and another in critical condition.
items.content: The Trump administration has halted all asylum decisions and paused issuing visas for people traveling on Afghan passports days after a shooting near the White House that left one National Guard member dead and another in critical condition.

items.title: Officials told to pause all asylum decisions in wake of National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: The Trump administration on Friday directed officials to pause all asylum decisions in the wake of the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington, D.C.
items.content: The Trump administration on Friday directed officials to pause all asylum decisions in the wake of the shooting of two National Guard soldiers in Washington, D.C.

items.title: Alleged National Guard shooter now faces murder charge, U.S. Attorney says
items.standfirst: Investigators are still searching for a motive after two National Guard members were shot near the White House on Wednesday. One died Thursday, while the other remains in critical condition. The alleged gunman now faces a first-degree murder charge, according to U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro.
items.content: Investigators are still searching for a motive after two National Guard members were shot near the White House on Wednesday. One died Thursday, while the other remains in critical condition. The alleged gunman now faces a first-degree murder charge, according to U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro.

items.title: Trump threatens migrants after National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: President Trump announced a series of immigration actions after the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday. Those actions include pausing all current asylum decisions and reviewing all green card holders from 19 "countries of concern."
items.content: President Trump announced a series of immigration actions after the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C., on Wednesday. Those actions include pausing all current asylum decisions and reviewing all green card holders from 19 "countries of concern."

items.title: Eye Opener: Trump says he's canceling all Biden executive orders signed by autopen
items.standfirst: President Trump announced that he's canceling all executive orders that former President Joe Biden signed with an autopen. Biden has repeatedly insisted he was the one making decisions, even when the autopen was used. Meanwhile, National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom died after being fatally shot in Washington, D.C. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
items.content: President Trump announced that he's canceling all executive orders that former President Joe Biden signed with an autopen. Biden has repeatedly insisted he was the one making decisions, even when the autopen was used. Meanwhile, National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom died after being fatally shot in Washington, D.C. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.

items.title: Where things stand with the National Guard shooting in D.C.
items.standfirst: The Trump administration has halted the processing of immigration requests from Afghans and the president vowed to tighten his immigration crackdown after the shooting of two National Guard members.
items.content: The Trump administration has halted the processing of immigration requests from Afghans and the president vowed to tighten his immigration crackdown after the shooting of two National Guard members.(Image credit: Jeff Swensen)

items.title: US halts all asylum claim decisions after National Guard shooting
items.standfirst: The directive comes hours after Donald Trump said the US will pause migration from "third-world countries".
items.content: The directive comes hours after Donald Trump said the US will pause migration from "third-world countries".

items.title: US pauses visas for all Afghan passport holders, halts asylum requests
items.standfirst: Pause on visas and halting of asylum applications comes after shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, DC.
items.content: Pause on visas and halting of asylum applications comes after shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, DC.

items.title: How were Afghan evacuees vetted under Biden?
items.standfirst: BBC Verify looks into claims that the Afghan national suspected of shooting two National Guard members in Washington DC entered the US unvetted.
items.content: BBC Verify looks into claims that the Afghan national suspected of shooting two National Guard members in Washington DC entered the US unvetted.

items.title: Trump vows permanent pause on migration from 'third world countries' after D.C. shooting
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will “permanently pause” all immigration from what he called “third world countries” and demanded a program of “reverse migration” as he intensified his rhetoric after the National Guard shooting in Washington, D.C.Trump offered few details as he disparaged and vowed to remove millions of migrants in the U.S. in a lengthy social media post late on Thanksgiving that came hours after he confirmed the death of National Guard soldier Sarah Bec
items.content: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he will “permanently pause” all immigration from what he called “third world countries” and demanded a program of “reverse migration” as he intensified his rhetoric after the National Guard shooting in Washington, D.C.Trump offered few details as he disparaged and vowed to remove millions of migrants in the U.S. in a lengthy social media post late on Thanksgiving that came hours after he confirmed the death of National Guard soldier Sarah Bec

items.title: U.S. to re-examine green card holders from 19 countries 'of concern'
items.standfirst: The announcement comes a day after an attack on National Guard troops near the White House. Authorities have identified the suspect as an Afghan national.
items.content: The announcement comes a day after an attack on National Guard troops near the White House. Authorities have identified the suspect as an Afghan national.

ai_summary: Trump announced he is canceling all Biden executive orders signed with an autopen.
Authorities are investigating the motive behind the shooting of National Guard members.
The Trump administration halted asylum decisions after the shooting.
The alleged National Guard shooter now faces a first-degree murder charge.
Trump announced immigration actions, including reviewing green card holders.

clusters.title: Authorities probe corruption and negligence in deadly Hong Kong apartment fire
clusters.neutral_headline: Hong Kong Mourns After Deadly Apartment Fire

items.title: Authorities probe corruption and negligence in deadly Hong Kong apartment fire
items.standfirst: Hong Kong’s deadliest fire in decades has raised questions about corruption and negligence in the renovations of the apartment complex where at least 128 people died.
items.content: Hong Kong’s deadliest fire in decades has raised questions about corruption and negligence in the renovations of the apartment complex where at least 128 people died.

items.content: At least 128 people have died and hundreds remain unaccounted for following the fire which engulfed several tower blocks.

items.title: Hong Kong begins three-day mourning period after deadly high-rise fire

items.content: Hong Kong began a three-day mourning period, after at least 128 people were killed in fires at a high-rise complex.

items.title: Hong Kong mourns victims of blaze as search for remains continues
items.standfirst: At least 128 people died and 150 remain missing after the towers housing 4,600 people were engulfed by flames.
items.content: At least 128 people died and 150 remain missing after the towers housing 4,600 people were engulfed by flames.

items.title: Hong Kong begins three days of mourning after deadly apartment fires
items.standfirst: Families are combing hospitals hoping to find their loved ones as about 200 people still listed as missing, and at least 128 killedAn outpouring of grief was set to sweep Hong Kong on Saturday as an official, three-day mourning period began with a moment of silence for the 128 people killed in one of the city’s deadliest fires.City leader John Lee, along with senior ministers and dozens of top civil servants, stood in silence for three minutes on Saturday morning outside the government headquarters, where the flags of China and Hong Kong were flown at half-mast. Continue reading...
items.content: Families are combing hospitals hoping to find their loved ones as about 200 people still listed as missing, and at least 128 killedAn outpouring of grief was set to sweep Hong Kong on Saturday as an official, three-day mourning period began with a moment of silence for the 128 people killed in one of the city’s deadliest fires.City leader John Lee, along with senior ministers and dozens of top civil servants, stood in silence for three minutes on Saturday morning outside the government headquarters, where the flags of China and Hong Kong were flown at half-mast. Continue reading...

items.title: Rescue efforts end at Hong Kong tower block fire as death toll reaches 128
items.standfirst: About 200 people still unaccounted for, say officials, as fire chief confirms no alarms went off in any of the eight towersAnger swells in Hong Kong over deadliest fire in more than 70 yearsHow the Hong Kong fire unfolded – visual guideThe death toll from the Hong Kong apartment complex fire that began on Wednesday has risen to 128 with as many as 200 missing, officials have said, as rescue operations were declared over.Firefighters had been combing through the high-rises on Friday, attempting to find anyone alive after the massive fire that spread to seven of eight towers in one of the city’s deadliest blazes. Continue reading...
items.content: About 200 people still unaccounted for, say officials, as fire chief confirms no alarms went off in any of the eight towersAnger swells in Hong Kong over deadliest fire in more than 70 yearsHow the Hong Kong fire unfolded – visual guideThe death toll from the Hong Kong apartment complex fire that began on Wednesday has risen to 128 with as many as 200 missing, officials have said, as rescue operations were declared over.Firefighters had been combing through the high-rises on Friday, attempting to find anyone alive after the massive fire that spread to seven of eight towers in one of the city’s deadliest blazes. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: HONG KONG — The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing estate in Hong Kong has killed at least 128 people, authorities said Friday, with some 200 people still missing and eight more arrested
items.content: HONG KONG — The inferno that tore through a high-rise housing estate in Hong Kong has killed at least 128 people, authorities said Friday, with some 200 people still missing and eight more arrested

ai_summary: At least 128 people died in a Hong Kong apartment fire.
Hundreds of people remain unaccounted for after the fire.
Authorities are probing corruption and negligence in the fire.
Hong Kong began a three-day mourning period.
Rescue efforts have ended, with the death toll at 128.

items.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88

ai_summary: Tom Stoppard, a British playwright, has died at the age of 88.
He won an Oscar for the screenplay of "Shakespeare in Love."
Stoppard was known for plays like "Arcadia" and "Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead."
He also wrote screenplays for "Brazil" and "Shakespeare in Love."
Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation.

items.standfirst: Far-right minister defends killing of two men who appeared to have given themselves up, saying ‘terrorists must die’Video of an Israeli military raid in the West Bank shows soldiers summarily executing two Palestinians they had detained seconds earlier.The shooting on Thursday evening, which was also witnessed by journalists close to the scene, is under justice ministry review, but has already been defended by Israel’s far-right minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, who declared that “terrorists must die”. items.title: Israeli forces kill two Palestinians after they appear to surrender

clusters.title: Experts say strict new FDA protocol for vaccine approval is ‘dangerous and irresponsible’

items.title: Experts say strict new FDA protocol for vaccine approval is ‘dangerous and irresponsible’
items.standfirst: Lead FDA vaccine regulator announced new approval process after claiming Covid vaccine had killed 10 childrenThe leading vaccine regulator at the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has announced a far stricter course for federal vaccine approvals, following claims from his team that Covid vaccines were linked to the deaths of at least 10 children.Experts suggest the announcement will make the vaccine approval process significantly more difficult. Continue reading...
items.content: Lead FDA vaccine regulator announced new approval process after claiming Covid vaccine had killed 10 childrenThe leading vaccine regulator at the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has announced a far stricter course for federal vaccine approvals, following claims from his team that Covid vaccines were linked to the deaths of at least 10 children.Experts suggest the announcement will make the vaccine approval process significantly more difficult. Continue reading...

items.title: Airbus Warns A320 Fleet Needs Software Fix After Incident
items.standfirst: Airbus SE cautioned that more than half of its active A320 jetliner family fleet will need a software fix after a recent incident involving a JetBlue Airways Corp. airliner revealed that “intense solar radiation” could corrupt data that helps maintain functioning flight controls.
items.content: Airbus SE cautioned that more than half of its active A320 jetliner family fleet will need a software fix after a recent incident involving a JetBlue Airways Corp. airliner revealed that “intense solar radiation” could corrupt data that helps maintain functioning flight controls.
